New Records: Rohit Sharma scored his 30th T20I fifty
Rohit Sharma hit his 599th and 600th sixes in international cricket
Rohit Sharma went past 4000 runs in T20Is
Key Match Events: Arshdeep Singh extracted inconsistent bounce and seam movement
Rohit Sharma and Rishabh Pant helped India cross the line with 46 balls remaining
Rohit Sharma hit two trademark pulls off successive balls from Josh Little that brought up his 599th and 600th sixes in international cricket
Rishabh Pant finished the match off the next ball, reverse-scooping Barry McCarthy for six over the wicketkeeper
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma and Rishabh Pant praised the Indian quicks for their performances
India's coach mentioned that the team's selection was spot-on, and they picked four fast bowlers including Hardik Pandya, and two spin-bowling allrounders
Miscellaneous Highlights: New York's second match as a T20I venue was a lot like its first: low-scoring and brutal
The bounce was just as inconsistent, and batting just as difficult, if not outright dangerous
The pitch will be remembered for the conditions, with batters from both teams taking body blows
India's thoughts may have gone ahead to June 9 at the same venue, and what kind of pitch they may have to play Pakistan on
